oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Linear Cryptanalysis: Key Schedules and Tweakable Block Ciphers
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Kranz, Thorsten
Leander, Gregor
Wiemer, Friedrich
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Linear Cryptanalysis
Key Schedule
Hypothesis of Independent Round Keys
Tweakable Block Cipher
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: This paper serves as a systematization of knowledge of linear cryptanalysis and provides novel insights in the areas of key schedule design and tweakable block ciphers. We examine in a step by step manner the linear hull theorem in a general and consistent setting. Based on this, we study the influence of the choice of the key scheduling on linear cryptanalysis, a – notoriously difficult – but important subject. Moreover, we investigate how tweakable block ciphers can be analyzed with respect to linear cryptanalysis, a topic that surprisingly has not been scrutinized until now.
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: IACR Transactions on Symmetric Cryptology; Volume 2017, Issue 1; 474-505
